head.title: Paid Notice: Deaths SCHWERIN, JULES V.

hedline.hl1: Paid Notice: Deaths SCHWERIN, JULES V.

block.p: SCHWERIN--Jules V. Of NYC, died last Sunday surrounded by love, four days after 85th birthday. Film-maker, author, journalist, a true gentle man of extraordinary artistic and moral courage. Life commitment to art, political activism, and social justice. Member DGA, educated at Northwestern. Produced 1976 Grammy-winning Mahalia Jackson album. Won 1993 ASCAP Deems Taylor Award for Jackson biography, ''Got To Tell It.'' Production Manager, Assistant Director to Paul Jarrico on famed blacklisted film ''Salt Of The Earth.'' Wrote, directed and produced documentaries, TV, and feature films. Survived by wife, Doris, son, Charles, and four grandchildren: Benjamin, Daniel, Joshua, Rachel.
